content: FYI this just happened to me (web UI). I'll keep an eye on it, as well. Screenshot_20220202-005249_Chrome.jpg
@Adam S: That looks like a different symptom. Does it have a broken image in a web browser, too?
Also, if you right-click on the image and say "open image in new tab" (or "copy image location" and then paste into a browser window) what do you see?

@Alex Vandiver right. I see:
https://domain.com/user_uploads/2/b5/N_bgsq09kTQMRc2BRpavnsCu/image.png
Editing and re-uploading fixed the issue. This doesn't happen every time.
This topic was moved here from #desktop > image corruption by Alex Vandiver

(the broken image in Adam S' last message is unrelated -- it's because Zulip is trying to preview the "image" from the literal domain.com which is a 404)

@Adam S: Right, that's a file upload link. What shows in your browser if you paste that actual URL in and ask it to go there? That is, is it a 404, a 500, a 0 byte 200 response, a dancing octopus..?

Assuming you're not using the S3 upload backend, what do you see if you:

ls -l ~zulip/uploads/files/2/b5/N_bgsq09kTQMRc2BRpavnsCu/image.png
